resources.string: We recommend that you include the following supplements in your diet to deal with the disease you are suffering from
We recommend that you include the following supplements in your diet to deal with the deficiency you are suffering from

Nowadays, most individual’s dietary habits are not healthy. Fast food, or high fat and
high cholesterol food, is popular, which can lead to obesity. The question, “how to stay healthy?” is asked by more and more people
around world. Therefore, they need information or instructions about staying
healthy and finding the correct work-out regime specific to an individual.
In addition, there are millions of people who suffer from various serious diseases.
For example, there are 10 million people who have cancer/phthisis around the world
and they really need help finding out about doctors/health centers or information
about their disease. Moreover, this information should be readily available and
on-the-go.
HealthyMe provides information about diseases and instructions for staying healthy to
people who want to become healthy or stay healthy. Feature to let people track
statuses of their own health through storage of medical reports or body information
will also be provided. In addition, users can communicate with other people,
patients and specialists (like doctors, dieticians and gym trainers) and get advice or
suggestions from them. This will also help in creating a social environment where
people with similar interests can share information with each other.
In addition, the application will provide a function for searching nearby areas for
medical and grocery stores. The application will devise a health plan according to the
user’s needs hence creating a personalized schedule for the user to follow. This
schedule can be exported to other calendars. The fusion of all these features in a
single application sets itself apart as being superior among other similar applications.

There are three different types of exercise for overall physical fitness: cardiovascular activity, strength conditioning, and flexibility training. These do not all have to be done at once, but doing each on a regular basis will result in balanced fitness.
Cardiovascular activity refers to activities that elevate your heart rate for an extended period of time. It refers to exercise that causes positive adaptations to the heart and lungs.

RECOMMENDATION: 

 Moderate physical activity for 30 mins a day, five days a week

 Or,

 Vigorous physical activity for 20 mins a day, three days per week

Examples:

- Outdoor Activities: walking, jogging, cycling, swimming, rollerblading, and cross-country skiing.

- Machines: treadmill, elliptical, recumbent bike, upright bike, stair climber. 

\ Safety tips:

 - Be sure to warm-up your body by performing low-intensity exercise(eg. walking, cycling) prior to higher intensity exercises.

 - Drink water

 - Stretch before and after any workout

 - When exercising at high intensity, it is important to cool-down, by gradually decreasing your intensity prior to stopping.

Strength training is a specialized method of conditioning designed to increase muscle strength, muscle endurance and muscle power.\n\nResistance training can be done is several ways: with resistance machines, free-weights (dumbbells and barbells), rubber tubing, or your own body weight (eg, push-ups, squats, or abdominal crunches).

RECOMMENDATION:

 Frequency: 2 to 3 days per week

 Intensity: It is best to choose 8 to 10 exercises which utilize the major muscle groups of the body

 Duration: It is important to keep the movements slow and controlled for the most effective workout

 Repetitions: 1 set of 8 to 12 repetitions

 Safety Tips:

 - A major safety concern regarding resistance training is the use of proper body alignment and technique when completing the exercise.

 - When using free weights be sure to place collars on the end of the bars to avoid weights sliding off.

 - Be sure to warm-up your body before resistance training.

Flexibility training include stretching exercises for the purpose of increasing ones range of motion throughtout a joint. Increased range of motion can improve mobility in sporting events as well as everyday activities.

RECOMMENDATION: 

 Activities: Perform a general stretching routine following exercises that have warmedup the body, targeting the major muscle and/or joint/tendon groups using static (non bouncing) techniques.

 Frequency: At least 3 days per week

 Intensity: Slowly stretching to a position of mild discomfort.

 Duration: Hold stretch for at least 10 seconds, working up to 30 seconds.

 Repetitions: Perform each stretch 3 to 5 times.

 Safety tips: 

 - Stretch after warming up the muscles and joints

 - Stretch slowly and smoothly only to the point of mild discomfort, avoid bouncing

 - Maintain normal breathing throughout each stretch
